image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from North Carolina; born in Ansonville Township, Anson County, N.C., November 1, 1898; attended Pee Dee Academy, Rockingham, N.C., and Trinity Park School, Durham, N.C., 1918-1920; was graduated from the law department of Wake Forest (N.C.) College in 1923; was admitted to the bar the same year and commenced practice in Rockingham, N.C.; register of deeds of Richmond County 1926-1934; attorney in the Wage and Hour Division, Department of Labor, Washington, D.C., in 1938 and 1939; in 1940 engaged in administrative law and in the general insurance business; served as chairman of the Richmond County Democratic executive committee 1932-1946; trustee of Wake Forest College; elected as a Democrat to the Eightieth and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1947-January 3, 1957); was an unsuccessful candidate for renomination in 1956 to the Eighty-fifth Congress; died in Rockingham, N.C., November 24, 1969; interment in Eastside Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1956 and n.d., 1 inch.
researchRecord.description: Includes missionary correspondence with John Burder Hipps and Edwin McNeill Poteat, Jr. A descriptive list is available in the Manuscript Collections Section.

recordLocation.name: North Carolina Baptist Historical Collection, Z. Smith Reynolds Library

researchRecord.name: 1919-1956, 1 microfilm reel (25 scrapbooks).
researchRecord.description: Includes scrapbooks covering Charles Deane's activities as a student at Trinity Park School, Durham, NC, and Wake Forest College, Deane-Burgin campaign, his congressional campaigns and career, and his trip to the Far East. A finding aid is available in the repository.

recordLocation.name: North Carolina Baptist Historical Collection, Z. Smith Reynolds Library

researchRecord.name: In the James William Fesler Papers, 1918-1991, 24.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Subjects covered include Charles Bennett Deane. An unpublished finding aid is available in the repository.

recordLocation.name: Manuscripts and Archives, Sterling Memorial Library

researchRecord.name: 1865; 1919-1978, 418.5 inches..
researchRecord.description: Manuscripts, typescripts, newsclippings, phototocopied and photographs relating to his political career and work with Meredith College, Wake Forest University, and the Baptists. A descriptive list is available in the Manuscript Collections Section.

recordLocation.name: North Carolina Baptist Historical Collection, Z. Smith Reynolds Library
